Quality Education: Improving education in schools is a critical issue in India, with far-reaching implications for the country's social and economic development. Access to quality education is a basic human right, and yet, many children are still denied this opportunity. By improving education, we can help to create a more equitable society and promote social and economic development in the long-run.

Reduced Inequalities: Sunbird Serve provides flexible and accessible educational opportunities, particularly for students in underserved areas or those facing physical barriers to education. These platforms enable students to access educational resources, interactive lessons, and collaborative tools, fostering a more inclusive learning environment (learn via local languages, learn from community based tutors, learn at one's own pace and comfort etc). Also facilitates remote learning and eliminates geographical constraints. Students can engage in real-time interactive sessions and collaborate with teachers, regardless of their location. Serve supports equitable access to quality education, especially for those in remote or disadvantaged areas.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: Sunbird SERVE is an open-source software available under MIT License. SERVE itself doesn't collect PII data or store or distributed. Each adopter manages their own SERVE instances where PII data could be collected and stored securely to achieve intended outcome. SERVE architecture is designed to work in a network model, using common protocol like DSEP. This enables the sharing of non PII data between various SERVE instances in the network.
